p:
Our approach to generating networks with tunable degree heterogeneity and group assortativity (or spatial structure) is a modified version of the configuration model [ 22]. In the basic model, N nodes are considered, and each node, i, is given a degree, k
i . We can think of the node i as having k
i adjacent half edges (or stubs) attached to it. Each stub is then paired with another stub to create an edge. The pairs are randomly selected with the following conditions: (a) that the two stubs must belong to different nodes (no self-loops), and (b) the stubs must belong to pair of nodes that are not already connected (no multi-edges).
